item.title: How much has biotechnology evolved since the 1980s?
item.description: The struggle with extraction and purification of secondary metabolites is that it is 1) difficult 2) costly and 3) time consuming (Class notes, Prof Finnie, 2019). Third world countries are often not politically or economically stable and so expencive techniques are not easily available to these nations. MacQueen (1988) highlighted some difficulties with the extraction of secondary metabolites and many of those difficulties are still problematic today. In addition, the size of natural habitats are decreasing because of anthropically driven global change (Lewis and Maslin, 2015; Isbell et al.
